product_overview: ICARUS v5.0 is a comprehensive, modular software platform tailored for healthcare and hospital management, featuring a fully implemented neumorphic design system, responsive UI, centralized API Gateway, and robust analytics dashboards. It aims to streamline operations through intuitive navigation, advanced forms, and data-driven insights across 29 main modules and 100+ sub-modules.
core_goals: Deliver a fully responsive and visually cohesive user interface utilizing a neumorphic design system.
Implement and complete all critical business, operational, and financial forms across modules by Q2 2025.
Achieve 100% module coverage with all sub-modules and forms by Q4 2025 for complete functional delivery.
Ensure high performance with lazy loading, code splitting, and fast load times (<2s).
Maintain top-tier code quality and accessibility standards with TypeScript, React 18, and Tailwind CSS.
Provide centralized API Gateway with comprehensive documentation and hooks to support scalable integrations.
Expand AI and Business Intelligence capabilities for predictive analytics and real-time monitoring by Q3 2025.
key_features: 100% implemented neumorphic design system with 150+ standardized CSS classes and reusable components (cards, buttons, inputs).
Dark mode toggle with theme persistence and adaptive neumorphic styles.
Responsive navigation system with collapsible sidebar, hamburger menu, and dynamic routing via React Router.
Dashboards featuring KPI cards with neumorphic icons and data visualizations using Recharts.
Centralized API Gateway with 19 pre-configured APIs and React hooks for seamless backend integration.
Form management with advanced multi-tab forms for medical, patient, and financial data input; 8 forms completed, 15-20 critical forms planned.
Responsive layout optimized for 16:9 screens with breakpoints for various device widths.
Error boundaries and lazy loading implemented for robust and performant user experience.
Planned expansion includes AI-driven predictive models, compliance auditing workflows, and advanced BI dashboards.
Comprehensive design tokens imported from Figma for color, typography, spacing, and shadows to maintain visual consistency.
user_flow_summary: User lands on Welcome page presenting the project overview, feature grids, call-to-action sections, and key statistics cards.
User navigates through responsive sidebar or top navigation to access modules such as Dashboard, Settings, and operational sub-modules.
User interacts with neumorphic components including cards, buttons, and inputs to input and review data across multiple tabs in advanced forms.
Users toggle between light and dark modes, with seamless theme persistence throughout the session.
Users access analytics dashboards featuring KPI cards and detailed data visualizations for decision-making.
Administrators utilize centralized API hooks to manage backend data integrations.
Users experience error handling and loading states transparently, with lazy loading of modules for performance optimization.
validation_criteria: All 29 main modules and 100+ sub-modules must be accessible with complete navigation and routing.
At least 25 critical forms fully implemented and functional by end of Q2 2025, including all required tabs and validation.
Performance benchmarks: Load times under 2 seconds for main pages under typical network conditions.
Theme toggle persists user preference across sessions and adapts neumorphic styles correctly.
100% compliance with accessibility standards including keyboard navigation and contrast.
API Gateway must expose all configured endpoints with proper React hooks and accompanying documentation.
No critical bugs reported in production; audit score maintained at 10/10.
Successful implementation of lazy loading and error boundaries validated by testing.
AI and BI dashboards must provide accurate, real-time data visualization as per roadmap by Q3 2025.
